title: Cs in the grading system

embed.description: Every game is a story; visit the new League of Legends match history to check out how this one ends and share your own!

body: So, i recently went super tryhard trying to get mastery 6 with kha'zix... As you can see by clicking on the link, i got a KDA of 31/0/7... and has a cs of 122, now, i really dont get why cs is such a big part in the grading system, and i think that should be fixed... i hope you share my opinion and if u do, make sure to give the RITO GAMES mods a heads up... thank you...

replies.body:
The question being asked can be more formally addressed as: How much information is present in each variable currently tracked, and are they properly weighted in a grading system? 

To answer this question and many like it we invented a system called Principal Component Analysis, which breaks down the results in just such a manner, produces new variables which represent the most significant aspects of the thing being measured, and consolidates the results into most important contributing features.

Examples of such techniques being used on League of Legends data:
http://www.manaless.com/2015/11/learn-statistics-and-data-mining-with.html

Because the point of the grading system isnt to farm kills and drag a game out that should have been over 20 minutes ago. Your team was sooooooooooooo far ahead yet it took you 40 minutes to finish the game? 127 cs in 40 minutes? **5 wards placed in 40 minutes with green trinket.** How is that even possible?

You didnt get an S because you dont deserve one
